entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 5:30AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...3 To 5 Inches Of Snow Tonight Through Sunday... Snow is expected to develop this evening across the Central Interior and continue into Sunday evening. Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected by Sunday evening when the snow tapers off. In Fairbanks 3 to 4 inches of snow is expected, with 5 inches of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 8:21PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue in the Chukchi Sea and Norton Sound Regions with low temperatures in the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will be in the teens and 20s below.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 8:06PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 10:17AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BRIEF ENHANCED SNOWFALL LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON... Small bands of enhanced snowfall will continue to move southeast across central Indiana late this morning and afternoon. entry.summary: ...Gusty north winds through late this afternoon... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 3:19AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: There is a chance of light snow in our area this morning. Snow accumulations will range 1 inch in the extreme Southern Panhandle and northwestern South Plains to only trace amounts in the southern South Plains. A few localized amounts to 2 inches may be possible. With warm surface temperatures, snow is mainly expected to accumulate on grassy areas; however, very light amounts may
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bailey; Briscoe; Castro; Cochran; Crosby; Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Lynn; Parmer; Swisher; Terry; Yoakum

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued February 12 at 2:43AM CST until February 12 at 11:00AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM CST /4 AM MST/ TO 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Guadalupe Pass in Texas. * WHEN...From 5 AM CST /4 AM MST/ to 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/
entry.cap:areaDesc: Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains
